articleinfo.title: &app; Manual V&manrevision;
articleinfo.releaseinfo: This manual describes version &appversion; of Synaptic Package Manager.

legalnotice.title: Feedback
legalnotice.para: To report a bug or make a suggestion regarding the &app; or this manual, use the bug report system at Synaptic Web, contact the mailing list synaptic@nongnu.org join the IRC channel #synaptic on irc.freenode.org.

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: The &app; enables you to manage your software. software is organizied in so called packages and &app; features upgrading, installing, removing or even of such software packages.
Modifcations on the status of packages are not immediatly . &app; collects the planned modifications in a queue commits them to apt. Apt is an unified package manager backend RPM and DEB systems.

sect2.title: To Find a Specific Package
sect2.para: You can search for a package in two different ways:

listitem.para: Search for a package name in the list of shown:
Type the name or a part of it into the find field located in the toolbar. &app; will automatically jump to the first matching package in the list
To find the next matching package press the the forward button next to the search field
To begin the search from the beginning of the package list click on the upward button
Filter the list of shown packages for a pattern e.g. show only packages from the maintainer Joe User or only packages with "german" in the name or description
Open the advanced search dialog via Search Advanced Search
Type the search expression into the find field
Select the fields that you want to search in
Click on Find to start the search

sect2.title: To Install a New Package
sect2.para: The following steps describe how to install a new package:

listitem.para: Select the package(s) that you wish to install in the
Choose one of the following ways to queue the package for installation:
Click on Install Latest Package in the package control area
Choose Package Install Latest Version
Right click on the package and choose Install Latest Version from the context menu
Press the key combination CRTL-I
To actually get the package installed you have to execute the queued changes:
Click on Execute in the toolbar
Choose from the menu Actions Execute
Press the key combination CTRL-E
Select the package(s) to be removed in the .
Choose one of the following ways to select the package for removal:
Click on Remove in the control of the inforamtion area.
Choose PackageRemove
Right click on the package and choose Remove
Press the key combination Remove

sect2.title: To Upgrade a Package
sect2.para: If a later version then the installed one of a package is available the Install Latest Version is renamed to Upgrade.

listitem.para: Select the package(s) to be upgraded in the .
Choose one of the following ways to select the package for upgrade:
Click on Upgrade in the control of the inforamtion area.
Choose PackageUpgrade
Right click on the package and choose Upgrade
Press the key combination CRTL-U

warning.para: Downgrading a package is a broken feature, since it is not supported by . It may work for you, but it is not recommended.

sect1.title: Using Filters
sect1.para: Filters enable you to narrow down the list of shown packages in the main package list.

sect2.title: To Apply a Predefined Filter
sect2.para: &app; comes with a list of predifend filters.

row.entry: Displays only currently not installed packages.
Displays only packages with a later version available.
Displays only packages with broken dependencies.
Displays only packages queued to be modified.
Displays only new packages since the last repository update.
Displays only former installed packages that left data or configuration files on the system.
Displays only packages that can be configured through the debian package configuration system, so called debconf.
Displays only packages that are not (for longer) included in one of the specified repositories.

sect2.title: To Edit and Create Filters
sect2.para: Filters can be created, deleted and modified in the filter editor. There are two to start the editor:

listitem.para: Choose from the menu Search Edit Filters...
Click on Filters... in the main window

sect3.title: To Change the View of the Results
sect3.para: You can choose between several sorting modes for matching packages. See HAHAH a detailed description of all available view modes.
